game_genres: Action, Adventure, Massively Multiplayer, Free To Play
review_text:
I just love me a battle royale that's somewhat grounded in reality. 
I love projectile-based combat. 
I love at least an attempt made, to keep real-world guns true to their real forms.
Leaning, ADS, prone, shoulder-fire AND hip fire options are great to have and play with.
Big maps. Lots of verticality. 

And its now free. 
It's just a good game imo. Very difficult. But reallllyy fun.

The same recycled game, which unfortunately does not have any competition. I want to play football and PES sucks. So...here we are.
Ignoring that fact, I hate the continuous push for online gameplay.
I'm not an online player. I like to play offline. Alone.
Ultimate Team is kind of addictive and Squad Battles was my favorite mode since it was introduced. Rush sadly is another online mode, adding to the already never ending list of online modes. Squad Battles was the only decent mode for me.
But it seems EA decided to nerf/kill it by decreasing the Squad Battles weekly games from 32 to 14!!!
I can't personally understand the reasoning behind this.
Why does every FC player need to play online? Do I have to rely on Career mode? Or just Kick-off?

For the first time in a long time, I'm not buying FC25. In fact, I'm cancelling my pre-order after submitting this review.
EA being EA...

I own Elden Ring and it's DLC for both PS5 and Steam. I like it.

ELDEN RING is the culmination of decades of design and while it isn't perfect, it's a more than worthy entry in a genre essentially invented by its spiritual predecessors. The Souls-Like has defined a generation of gaming and the medium is better off for it. There's something to be said about a best-selling entry in a franchise among the greatest of all time being a singleplayer, box product in a market saturated with live-service multiplayer and predatory monetization. We can only hope that the success of ELDEN RING teaches big studios the right lessons.

Best game ever period.

TL;DR: Solid 8/10 Main Game

Pros:
-Fantastic lore/world building
-Fantastic gameplay
-Huge world with things to do
-Great graphics/art direction
-Phenomenal soundtrack 
-Easy to get into for casual gamers, with plentiful options to make the game significantly easier

Cons:
-PC stuttering caused by shader compilation
-Certain bosses reward good RNG for a run instead of only outplaying them, however every boss is beatable with pure skill alone even if the boss uses their hardest/cheesiest moves. For example beating Malenia felt more like getting a good run than out-skilling her,
-World is vast but does not reward exploration for your specific build (i.e. there's no point in exploring if you already have a build in mind with specific talismans, etc.). Basically if there's nothing you need in a certain area then there's no point going there except for leveling purposes.
-Final boss of the main game is one of the worst main bosses

My Build:
-Melee only strength/stagger build with a two-handed colossal great sword, lion's claw, talismans that boost this playstyle, no summons, no cheesing bosses

The glitchiest supposed triple-a game you have ever played. Fun gameplay loop, but quest turn ins will randomly disappear, you will get logged out in the middle of boss fights, random objectives are glitched and unwinnable... Also, full-priced game with in-game cash shop.

The fun part ends when you reach lv50, then it's no longer rewarding for either continuing main quests or farming side quests while you haven't finished the main story. 

It's so boring and so like mmorpg while I am only interested in single player experience.

pretty fun game for being a clone to POE. good voice acting pretty good story line keeping me hooked thus far. I would like to see a few QOL thought. Allow us to rotate the camera on our chacters. not pan them around just Rotaite the screen. maybe an auto item loot pick up system and a filter out so you only pick up say rare or magic and higher. a way to see which quest we have or havnt compeated. maybe a second hot bar to be switched to. for example you press Alt+2 and your hot bar rotates to your second load out.  guild events for rewards. nothing huge but maybe buffs? but not overpowering buffs but like +12% EXP. or +15% Coin drop you get the idea. maybe a caravan escort mission. I could probably go on. Graphics a decent I really enjoyed the still screen moments. and like I said the storys were well done and had me encrosed. but I like playing side quest and taking my time with storys. OH unlock the horse a little sooner. I get kind of why you dont have it unlock until it does. But it would seem to me that it would entice people to Rush to act 4 faster maybe im wrong. Other than those few things which arent a deal breaker for me Great job. I give it a full 6 pack of Zima.

finally hit 100 hours, time for a collection of thoughts about the game

Pros
-feels like a older game in the gameplay sense, feels like the original gears of war games or halo
-After 100 hours im still looking foward to playing more
-Day 1 gave us a road map detailing the next year of content new maps for pve and pvp, new modes for pvp and pve, new enemies in pve, new weapons and more
-PvP is incredibly fun and isnt a grind fest to jump into the fun, hop in do some pvp, go back to pve no problem
- Gameplay as a whole is the best part of the game, its never been more fun to hop in and kill some heretics or some nids with a fury that would make the God Emperor of Mankind proud
-perk system is not overly complicated
-HIGH SKILL CEILING on higher difficulties when it comes to keeping your health afloat so long as your not using a melta weapon in which case the game is easy mode

cons

-issues with servers right now
-weapon balance needs to be fixed (bolt weapons need a fix for pve)
-certain enemies on ruthless difficulty feel way too meat spongy
-some extremis enemies will sometimes never die regardless of damage dealt sometimes which can kill runs on higher difficulties
-need more maps but they are otw

Do all of this while looking like the most adorable little evil menace that you can customize to your liking. 

Had enough of the team beatup game for a bit? Try the coop pirate mode where you have to fend of a bunch of pirates with your friends or maybe try one of the team game modes like football, hockey or american football. Looking for something different than smashing enemies? Maybe the winter cabin mode is better for you with a bunch of cozy activities and card games. Feeling more like playing a certain kart racer, but dont want to go through the hazzle of paying for another game? Try Nemo Kart (its also in this game)!

Other note worthy stuff:
- Game requires a consistent internet connection, there is no offline mode (yet).
- You can invite a friend along without them having to pay for the game.
- Cosmetics in the game are 99.9% obtainable with in game currencies or through events, exceptions are certain collab skins. 
- All the event passes (battle passes) have been completely free up til now.
- The game updates consistantly.
- There is no penguin animal skin (pls Recreate i beg).

I was 13 years old when I got this game, to give you a frame of reference im 25 now. I was always excited for the npc update and I get that somethings were out of their control such as their servers being stolen years ago or it was wiped I cant exactly remember. This game was a blast and I understand the devs are working hard on the npcs and I hope its worth it, but ive waited over a decade of my life to see semblance of what would change this game forever. They've been dangling this carrot in front of us for over a decade. Its actually wild. At one point npcs were talked about so much that they started muting and banning people over it. I don't blame them. What I do blame them for is how long this has taken. Over a decade really? No transparency until recently. Used to be my favorite devs, now i'm just sad. B42 now to B43, I feel like npcs are never gonna happen. 


Maybe instead of perfecting a decade old game you guys should complete this product and move on to the next with bigger and better ideas. 
Maybe you guys should realize we aren't looking for perfection and looking for more gameplay mechanics to extend the life of this game. 

How about you fix your shit with player feedback?

Or is the code so far gone you are gonna push back the date for eternity or until you tell us its scrapped? 

I'm only saying this out of a place of love for the game you guys have made and as a 
disappointed customer.

To one of my favorite devs to a team I no longer believe in, I sure hope you guys release what you promised over a decade ago.

I have been playing this game off and on for the last year or so. I enjoyed the vanilla version of the game, but I really started to enjoy it with the many mods that are able to be implemented. It helps make a realistic game a little more realistic, definitely worth the cost and you can find yourself getting lost in the lore and gameplay.

The longer you survive, the more you'll care about surviving but in the beginning I couldn't even muster the motivation to care that I was dying. Everything is a chore, literally. Yes, its mechanics are deep and interesting. And I can understand why someone would find satisfaction in a game like this but if you're looking to play a game... I don't even know if this qualifies as a game. It feels more like taking care of a really shitty tamagotchi.
